intro: Centropogon trianae, commonly known as the Trianas' centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom during the warmer months. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
